00118 #include <cstdlib>
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * The func_info constructor adds the names of the function parameters into its scope.
00122  * When a compound statement is parsed : it checks for the flag_cmpd_stmt_is_a_func_body and
00123  * loads that into the active scope if set.
00124  * Note that flag_cmpd_stmt_is_a_func_body is initialized to -1 as the 1st function 
00125  * will be in index 0 of func_info_table vector.
00126  * Also lookup_func searches the func_info_table for the function name and returns -1 on failure
00127  * this is naturally compatible with the initial value of flag_cmpd_stmt_is_a_func_body
00128  * if the flag is not set -> we need to allocate a new scope - else we will crash
00129  */
00130 #include "scope.h"
00131 /*
00132 struct func_info;
00133 //#include "stmt.h"
00134 struct stmt;
00135 struct func_info{
00136         string fname;
00137         struct var_list * param_list;
00138         datatype return_type;
00139         struct stmt * func_body;
00140         struct scope * func_scope;
00141         func_info(string name, struct var_list* elist, datatype myreturn_type); 
00142         void print(FILE * fptr);
00143         ~func_info();
00144 private:
00145         func_info& operator=(const func_info&);
00146         func_info(const func_info&);
00147 };*/
